description.narrative: (i) Private sector development: Fund will improve local companies' competitiveness by providing equity capital and management advice and by adding value through capacity building and ESG improvements (ii) Economic growth and Job creation: Fund will invest in high-growth companies that will create new employment opportunities at a higher rate than national averages, thereby contributing to economic development end employment (iii) Regional integration: Fund will support platform companies seeking to roll out their products and services across neighboring countries. Strategy to build 'regional champions' that will achieve sufficient scale to compete against multinational competitors and access international capital markets

The project entails an IFC equity investment of up to $20 million in Portland Caribbean Fund II (PCF II or the Fund), a 10-year closed-end fund that seeks to raise $200-300 million to invest in 6-10 companies in various sectors (financial services, infrastructure/energy, ICT, agribusiness, consumer-oriented/retail, health care and property) predominantly in the Caribbean (though Fund may invest up to 20% in adjacent countries, i.e. Central America or Colombia).

name.narrative: The Fund will be a Cayman Islands limited partnership (LP) focused on investing in portfolio companies domiciled in Caribbean Basin countries, which include all of the CARICOM member states (including Jamaica, Trinidad, Barbados and several others) and CARICOM associate member states (eg. Cayman Islands), Dominican Republic, Colombia, and Central America, including Panama and Costa Rica.
